intro: Teyleria barbata, commonly known as the barbed tamarind, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive barbed hairs on its stems and leaves, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Teyleria barbata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
